document.title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards for English Language Arts

88EF710FE68F4746ACFDCE87A6D7103E.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

4C1849671006483D88FC4AF86DFDFCBC.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

790416B5500B42549EEDC9C18C5FF635.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

35CA0DED03514FA698FBEA776A3F22D3.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

323D869FD2BF4EDF8CFBEB4324DCAB8D.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

E478D1C8480D4130B223F94A682273B8.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

76E18B1ACF2C4962B7BDB985A19901DA.description: Use the most frequently occurring affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, -ing) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

0D6B40C5B1F943F39425A87F50AEC4B1.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

B3C52A7233324A60975CCF9EA47C593C.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

81D45C01463F4583B4CDBE726491659B.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

D674AD0FD9B74E36A36FA37E37834DA0.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

2E66B7A9B9944520846DC3F71B5C9BD9.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

1E3F831152E442B0B939CD2E1F2FC29A.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

F62B37775F5C47FD9A4A836BBB4F0A21.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

768EA21A56494248B614F7CF57AA373F.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

C7BC1091D3AD42AB883BB161DCDE9072.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

56DD29BF4CC84CD08CA37E9D5FE1F91B.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

F891B75B68C04841AAA42165DE54BB63.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

BFDA3BB5F721477C9061143D54A443C8.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

3CF475BF60B14B6D8895493701870CDE.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

D857890149D44102AEE917F9FEA646E8.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

BB921A84AC7A4884B7469B15E9B08051.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

CCD84458888345ACBA5B74DB86D0F2C6.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

9E22EAEAEEAC408D9C38C646DA294669.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

84360890A70746FBB41FD9E55E2A7010.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

76CEB99755ED449F9F05787990940476.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

3990B2A9861F4914B56CCD24FBD67A72.description: Follow agreed-upon norms for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

CD890C84132E41BEB9FE92F24742D066.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

427BD990DA4C4343B0817FABCAC5B71A.description: Progress Indicators for Speaking and Listening

488A7CD58DEE48D183B91E163A08A967.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

CD8E90BC6BB74076AD0B65C7657E8860.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

199AC3E648F241AA8601AD2B212456CE.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

3EE990081ED740BC8CA9B0A0E6AFF778.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

0EE4E108E4224BB498BD77ACF38F8291.description: With guidance and support from adults, strengthen writing through response and self-reflection using questions and suggestions from peers (e.g., adding details).

55A346784D9A45A4B0ADAF002B46698B.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

B01F36B3CFA14F9DAFD1F2A188CFB1D0.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

75019E63E0DC40AFA663DE3A1FCD24C7.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book isâ€¦).

DAD3522A172C49DCBB7DEBBB95ED2644.description: Read grade level text for purpose and understanding.

5DB01C7FB73D46208829897DCF55C13C.description: Read emergent-readers with purpose and understanding.

35DA6F3C03074860A11D24AF47DB3F36.description: Read emergent text with one-to-one correspondence to develop fluency and comprehension skills.

41C49DDF682C47998B7229DE374DA8E5.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ (e.g., nap and tap; cat and cot).

511D9D78E8714EA4A961A7AAF724F8FD.description: Read high-frequency and sight words with automaticity.

0634F7138B00468680BED270AA37B1B0.description: Associate the long and short sounds with the common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

9B552C5C33CD47BE88073784CD2CC94A.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing many of the most frequently used sounds of each consonant.

3DF2D136F94C4F94AA2CA4D6E3AEB032.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding and encoding words.

42F760DB04B14BCC94D6964767CA1CE7.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

0FC1CC5AE63E46C89AE501B19280D71B.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words.

4DB49EC2FDD04013AFA7627405070AC9.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

9C5DF7BAD4334412B109B6F1D7C25030.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

3B92E0FFFF38480BBBC121D68D74CAC1.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

19B7864E9AAF43B68F7C39BEC50FBD34.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

DAE63244861947F9BC4379606AE27285.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

3D404F97EE2D42EBB0E55984B1E5D98C.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

82565139E98C48AE95155E2CF24A3C57.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

7F3E17538B904AD9A79D57F93C945CFB.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

52E7A5E5B7B7428DA735FB00CCA3C0C1.description: Progress Indicators for Reading Foundation Skills

6EEFF952F21E480782742CC2FF589A8E.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

5716E9C1AFF145B485E829B4A81DEF03.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

D065879C980340D7ACE9063FF2AB1562.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

C7816C867257482E89D66A5F3001882E.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

3D8C64B188454454BDD2B8AC4A5F60EA.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

B6FF0B750D66440F8F2BA2ADA69854DC.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

728EBC1B9A814DF2956B120F0B2F4C3B.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

8934EAF7E296470CAC3D5AF497D1C44B.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

F06A571490AF479C93A302DEC52291D3.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

7EF1DE1FE1AA4697A5F5CE868B7776ED.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

C40F91FF39154D0D98C32CB3B3F62A8E.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

D91FF30E50CB4625B2C5302946191798.description: Progress Indicators for Reading Informational Text

4AC45CBC286142838CC98555174C88E2.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

CBD4D67D7BAB4606B91C812D0819FA58.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

8959A76140E14500A7DE76E4CBC09D4A.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

218396353B4F475ABF934A8178528546.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

11851B70198B440595FACABFF822EC1C.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

037B3F4AE0F04857BE42ED06E1D3D3C4.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

6C425133F1B24CA3BF5E65E1F950FB47.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

2C43199307D84A95B4B2C63EB67CC617.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

7EC517747E5344BDA7449792862923C2.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

149FB09B9FC64ED78D587CA86F79047A.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how)

6B8DE3442F724AF2826C5D454063836B.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

E9FDC7BE72F94218B5AB876103B3A17F.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

1487AA2C222F4CD3A88D55D734D3C9C1.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

25094D7C714A487CB2843B5EAD0C2C05.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

4DF3156DB507428FA521487F118262E2.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

2D8DBEF773C64826BCF7570DDFD021BE.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

9A6583230B5F4FC6B6F8C103DF939E46.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

803FD74C82824A8A8B2EDAEA0E103259.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

CAE166FF2B9F4344B285CC6C98329CFA.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

F88048550C5F4207B9872ED7EE9E46D5.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

1D7D96C3BAE54E80AA4353679F4F4039.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

D5D2F957D89D4188A378F3AF279DDFDA.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

8D3797D9ED3F4B97BEA573D13C044C20.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

5E3E9F9651504310B11873C297F4473A.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

3A07D506AF034B83BE1C2C881732814D.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

6AC0185162F945B3916CDBBC1A948367.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects, utilizing an inquiry-based research process, based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

AB1BF844663D4F09B390887B17551D11.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

A30D96EF2820426BA1DB0839C8B29739.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

0F48C881C855491C8A6C8369759FEAB7.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

B04726E5EA68477FB9EF0181DE6D012A.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

2FBCE0852FED4E9693563DCC9BB03138.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

927296B96C064C8AA305475AAE58EB42.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

97244666FADD4D039B2A8C95BE811384.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

6765251DCA9B49E281ADE96A292E8E3D.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently with scaffolding as needed.

DE82449A0E1244ABB82A0F9E1459AAE9.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

AD3EBECD1D0D4764998864A2DC1D6C76.description: Analyze and reflect on how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

540602460A904A56A891173E779300AE.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

9E0CBBD2530D4100BF931AC0BDB7C255.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

3A7E75EDF65D4455B1574E5DA0757B11.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

143E4ABD847C44F1B0832D6E71640A30.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

89DE681D976F41E797001B332D499559.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

B2D8CDE1C9A940BC96133E0DFF046135.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

3EB2D743F88F4F40B0BE4D4B9F734DEA.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

E2254E46C7344037AA4E657C4FCCAF6F.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences and relevant connections from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
